title: Shares across Asia fall sharply amid US-Chinese trade tensions
text: Australia’s ASX200 index down 1.46%, Tokyo off 2% and Hong Kong falls 3.3% as fears grow about a global recession

title: Shares of Japanese automakers, South Korean chipmakers fall on escalating trade fears
text: China said Friday it will be resuming 25% duties on U.S. autos, and a further 5% on auto parts and components.

title: Oil falls as trade war raises recession fears
text: Oil prices fell on Monday, pushing U.S. crude to its lowest in more than two weeks, as an intensifying U.S.

title: China state media blasts U.S. after Trump threats
text: Chinese state media on Monday blasted the United States after U.S. President Donald Trump announced additional tariffs on goods from China and lashed out at China and ordered U.S. companies to find “alternatives” to China.

title: Oil down nearly 2% as trade war shakes confidence
text: Brent crude was down 89 cents, or 1.5%, at $58.45 a barrel by 0044 GMT, having earlier touched $58.24, the lowest since Aug. 15.

title: Everything that happened over the weekend with the US-China trade war
text: Tensions stemming from the U.S.-China trade war escalated sharply over the last few days, with much happening as Asian markets were shut down for the weekend.

title: Trump wants US companies to leave China. Here's what it could mean for Chinese businesses
text: The latest round of tariff announcements means that by year end, essentially all Chinese goods exported to the U.S. will be subject to duties.

title: Asia shares shaken, yen jumps on China-U.S. trade jitters
text: Asian shares seemed set for a turbulent start on Monday as the latest salvo in the U.S.-China trade war shook confidence in the world economy and sent investors steaming to the safe harbor of sovereign bonds and the Japanese yen.

title: Dow futures drop 300 points at the open as US-China trade war escalates
text: Futures fell after Trump said the U.S. will raise tariffs on more than $500 billion worth of Chinese imports, increasing trade tensions.

title: Top investor gives four winning plays as violent market swings grip market
text: Bryn Mawr Trust CIO Jeffrey Mills lists where to put money to work as Wall Street copes with trade war and recession jitters.

title: Kudlow does not expect China to retaliate against Trump's latest tariffs despite Beijing's warning
text: Despite Kudlow's expectations, China said on Saturday that it strongly opposes Trump's decision to levy additional tariffs on $550 billion worth of Chinese goods, and warned the U.S. of consequences if it does not end its "wrong actions.

title: The 5 Major Averages Have Negative Weekly Charts With Only 1 Value Level
text: As August comes to an end along with the third quarter, there’s only one value level among the five major equity averages. The key level to hold is the annual pivot at 7,370 on the Nasdaq Composite.

title: Trump regrets not raising tariffs on China higher, White House says
text: When President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he had second thoughts about escalating the trade war with China, he meant that he wished he had raised tariffs on Beijing even higher, the White House said.

title: Kudlow does not expect China to retaliate against latest U.S. tariffs
text: White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Sunday that he does not expect China to retaliate against additional tariffs on Chinese goods that U.S. President Donald Trump announced Friday.

title: White House says Trump regrets not raising tariffs on China higher
text: Hours after President Trump said Sunday he had "second thoughts" about escalating the trade war with China, the White House sought to explain his remark because it was "greatly misinterpreted."

title: Bond yields are on a path lower as recessions risks rise: Strategist
text: The Federal Reserve's increasingly risk-conscious stance puts bond yields on a course lower, and not necessarily for good reason, says Bank of America Merrill Lynch's Mark Cabana.

title: No ready spark seen for lagging U.S. energy shares
text: There may be little relief on the horizon for investors in U.S. energy companies, whose shares moved from darlings to dismal performers during Wall Street's record bull run and now face a shaky global economy, doubts about fossil fuel investments and general market skepticism.

title: Is a global recession coming? Here are seven warning signs
text: The US-China trade war, jitters in Germany and Brexit uncertainty point to a slump

title: The Next U.S. Recession Looking More Likely As Trump Weaponizes Trade And The Dollar
text: The business outlook has dimmed because companies are no longer sure where and with whom they can invest and expand without incurring the ire of the U.S. President, and it is affecting companies in America as well as in the rest of the world.

title: At G7 summit, Trump hints at a 'very big trade deal' with Britain post Brexit
text: President Donald Trump said that he would have a major trade deal with U.K. after it leaves the European Union.

title: Trump on US-China trade war: 'I could declare a national emergency'
text: Clouding the G-7 gathering, which represents the world's major industrial economies, are the tit-for-tat tariffs between Washington and Beijing.

title: China to fight back against U.S. tariff move: People's Daily
text: China will fight back against the latest U.S. step to increase tariffs on Chinese goods, the ruling Communist Party's People's Daily said on Sunday amid an escalating trade war between the world's two largest economies.
